intro: Hieracium armerioides subsp. absconditum, commonly known as the hidden hawkweed, is a rare and elusive perennial herb native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct botanical features, including its small, inconspicuous flowers and hairy stems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
